alert.note: Alert for Buncombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:27PM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Asheville affecting Buncombe County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River at Asheville. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...The French Broad River is flooding parts of the Woodfin Riverside Park, the floodplain adjacent to Craggy Dam Reservoir, Carrier Park, and French Broad River Park. Floodwaters may be approaching Amboy Rd. and Lyman St. Local small tributaries including Smith Mill Creek near Emma Rd. may be exceeding bankfull levels. The French Broad River is beginning to flood low-lying areas near Pearson Bridge Rd. and may be approaching industrial property. The River fall continue to fall this afternoon and return to within it`s banks tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 2.4 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
